content:
That could be a powerful climax for the story, it would be a moment where the main characters are forced to confront the reality of the situation and where their desire to hold on to their past life comes into conflict with the needs and desires of the allies.

The idea of Edgar and Rachel's bubbly behavior and weird affection towards Indy making Chris and Anna feel uneasy throughout the story is a great way to build tension and to create a sense of unease in the audience.

When Chris and Anna try to flee with Indy, it would be a moment of high drama and it would put the main characters in a difficult position. This climax can be a turning point in the story, as it forces the main characters to confront the reality of the situation and to realize that they can't keep holding on to the past.

As the climax leads to Edgar and Rachel's eventual change at the end, it will be a satisfying arc for the main characters. This climax can be a moment of realization for the main characters and it will be a moment that will change them in some way.
